column2: 2. The night time curfew for 16 and 17 year olds is:
column4: 12am to 4am.
column6: 11pm to 5am.

column4: No left turn
column6: No U-turns

column2: 4. When the road is slippery you should:
column4: check your brakes.
column6: decrease the following distance.

column2: 5. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column8: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.

column2: 8. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: slow down and pass the bus with caution.
column6: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column8: stop if you are driving in the same direction.

column2: 9. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.

column2: 14. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column6: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column8: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.

column2: 15. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: in school zones.
column6: at most intersections.

column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 17. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 18. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 19. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column6: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.

column2: 20. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column4: All of the above.
column6: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 22. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column4: brown and white.
column6: green and white.

column2: 23. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column6: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
column8: The other answers are both correct.
